008 *******************************************************************************/
009
010package imagingbook.common.image.access;
011
012import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.image.GridIndexer2D;
015import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
016import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
017import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * An 'image accessor' is a wrapper around some {@link ImageProcessor} object to allow
022 * unified (read and write) access to its pixels values.
023 * This abstract class defines unified access functionality to all 4 types of images available in ImageJ:
024 * 8-bit, 16-bit, float, and color images.
025 * All pixel values are of type {@code float[]}, either containing a single element (for
026 * scalar-valued images) or three elements (for color images).
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * A generic {@link ImageAccessor} is created, e.g., by {@link #create(ImageProcessor)}, which
030 * returns an instance of {@link ByteAccessor}, {@link ShortAccessor}, {@link FloatAccessor} or
031 * {@link RgbAccessor}.
032 * {@link ImageAccessor} itself can access any ImageJ image using 
033 * the methods {@link #getPix(int, int)}, {@link #getPix(double, double)}
034 * for retrieving pixel values and {@link #setPix(int, int, float[])}
035 * to modify pixel values.
036 * </p>
037 * <p>
038 * In addition, the accessors for scalar-valued images ({@link ByteAccessor}, {@link ShortAccessor},
039 * {@link FloatAccessor}) provide the methods
040 * {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(int, int)}, {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(double, double)} and 
041 * {@link ScalarAccessor#setVal(int, int, float)}
042 * to read and write scalar-valued pixels passed as single {@code float} values.
043 * <br>
044 * The methods {@link #getPix(double, double)} and {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(double, double)} perform interpolation at non-integer coordinates
045 * using the specified {@link InterpolationMethod}.
046 * </p>
047 * <p>
048 * A related concept for providing unified access to images is {@link PixelPack},
049 * which copies all pixel data to internal {@code float} arrays.
050 * In contrast to {@link PixelPack}, {@link ImageAccessor} does not duplicate
051 * any data but reads and writes the original {@link ImageProcessor} pixel data
052 * directly.
053 * </p>
054 * 
055 * @author WB
056 * @version 2020/12/27
057 * @see PixelPack
058 */
059public abstract class ImageAccessor {
060        
061        /** The default out-of-bounds strategy (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
062        public static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.ZeroValues;
063        /** The default pixel interpolation method (see {@link InterpolationMethod}). */
064        public static final InterpolationMethod DefaultInterpolationMethod = InterpolationMethod.Bilinear;
065        
066        protected final float defaultValue = 0.0f;
067        
068        protected final ImageProcessor ip;
069        protected final int width;
070        protected final int height;
071        protected final GridIndexer2D indexer;          // implements the specified OutOfBoundsStrategy
072        protected final OutOfBoundsStrategy outOfBoundsStrategy;
073        protected final InterpolationMethod interpolationMethod;
074        
075        /**
076         * Creates a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance for the given image,
077         * using the default out-of-bounds strategy and interpolation method.
078         * The concrete type of the returned instance depends on the specified image.
079         * 
080         * @param ip the source image
081         * @return a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance
082         */
083        public static final ImageAccessor create(ImageProcessor ip) {
084                return create(ip, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy, DefaultInterpolationMethod);
085        }
086        
087        /**
088         * Creates a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance for the given image,
089         * using the specified out-of-bounds strategy and interpolation method.
090         * The concrete type of the returned instance depends on the specified image.
091         * 
092         * @param ip the source image
093         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy (use {@code null} for default settings)
094         * @param ipm the interpolation method (use {@code null} for default settings)
095         * @return a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance
096         */
097        public static ImageAccessor create(ImageProcessor ip,  OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
098                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
099                        return new RgbAccessor((ColorProcessor)ip, obs, ipm);
100                }
101                else {
102                        return ScalarAccessor.create(ip, obs, ipm);
103                }
104        }
105        
106        // constructor (used by all subtypes)
107        ImageAccessor(ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
108                this.ip = ip;
109                this.width  = ip.getWidth();
110                this.height = ip.getHeight();
111                this.outOfBoundsStrategy = (obs != null) ? obs : DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy;
112                this.interpolationMethod = (ipm != null) ? ipm : DefaultInterpolationMethod;
113                this.indexer = GridIndexer2D.create(width, height, this.outOfBoundsStrategy);
114        }
115        
116        /**
117         * Returns the width of the associated image.
118         * @return the image width.
119         */
120        public int getWidth() {
121                return this.width;
122        }
123        
124        /**
125         * Returns the height of the associated image.
126         * @return the image height.
127         */
128        public int getHeight() {
129                return this.height;
130        }
131        
132        /**
133         * Returns the source {@link ImageProcessor} associated with this
134         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
135         * 
136         * @return the image processor
137         */
138        public ImageProcessor getProcessor() {
139                return this.ip;
140        }
141        
142        /**
143         * Returns the depth (number of components) of this image
144         * accessor. 1 is returned if the image is scalar-valued.
145         * 
146         * @return the image depth.
147         */
148        public abstract int getDepth();
149        
150        /**
151         * Returns the {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy} specified for this
152         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
153         * 
154         * @return the out-of-bounds strategy
155         */
156        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy() {
157                return outOfBoundsStrategy;
158        }
159
160        /**
161         * Returns the {@link InterpolationMethod} specified for this
162         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
163         * 
164         * @return the interpolation method
165         */
166        public InterpolationMethod getInterpolationMethod() {
167                return interpolationMethod;
168        }
169        
170        /**
171         * Returns the pixel value for the specified floating-point 
172         * position as a {@code float[]} with either 1 element for scalar-valued images
173         * and or more elements (e.g., 3 for for RGB images).
174         * 
175         * @param u the x-coordinate
176         * @param v the y-coordinate
177         * @return the pixel value ({@code float[]})
178         */
179        public abstract float[] getPix(int u, int v);
180        
181        /**
182         * Returns the interpolated pixel value for the specified floating-point 
183         * position as a {@code float[]} with either 1 element for scalar-valued images
184         * and or more elements (e.g., 3 for for RGB images).
185         * Interpolation is used non-integer coordinates.
186         * 
187         * @param x the x-coordinate
188         * @param y the y-coordinate
189         * @return the interpolated pixel value ({@code float[]})
190         */
191        public abstract float[] getPix(double x, double y);             // returns interpolated pixel value at real position (x, y)
192        
193        /**
194         * Sets the pixel value at the specified integer position.
195         * The new value must be provided as {@code float[]} with 
196         * 1 element for scalar-valued images or 3 elements for RGB images.
197         * @param u the x-coordinate
198         * @param v the y-coordinate
199         * @param val the new pixel value ({@code float[]})
200         */
201        public abstract void setPix(int u, int v, float[] val);
202        
203        /**
204         * Returns the value of the pixel's k-th component at the
205         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
206         * this is equivalent to component 0.
207         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
208         * 
209         * @param u the x-coordinate
210         * @param v the y-coordinate
211         * @param k the component index
212         * @return the component value ({@code float})
213         */
214        public abstract float getVal(int u, int v, int k);
215        
216        
217        /**
218         * Returns the interpolated value of the pixel's k-th component at the
219         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
220         * this is equivalent to component 0.
221         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
222         * 
223         * @param x the x-coordinate
224         * @param y the y-coordinate
225         * @param k the component index
226         * @return the interpolated component value ({@code float[]})
227         */
228        public abstract float getVal(double x, double y, int k);
229        
230        /**
231         * Sets the value of the pixel's k-th component at the
232         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
233         * this is equivalent to component 0.
234         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
235         * 
236         * @param u the x-coordinate
237         * @param v the y-coordinate
238         * @param k the component index
239         * @param val the new component value
240         */
241        public abstract void setVal(int u, int v, int k, float val);
242        
243        /**
244         * Returns the {@link ImageAccessor} for the k-th component;
245         * the result is a sub-type of {@link ScalarAccessor}.
246         * In the case of a scalar-valued image, THIS object is returned.
247         * 
248         * @param k the component index
249         * @return the component accessor.
250         */
251        public abstract ScalarAccessor getComponentAccessor(int k);
252        
253        abstract void checkComponentIndex(int k);
254                
255}
